column2: Q1: In your neighborhood, do you feel you are experiencing air quality problems? If so, what are the specific air quality problems and how are they impacting you, your family, or your neighbors?
column3: Q2: The City plans to install air quality monitoring sensors across Madison. Where would you like to see these sensors located (e.g., shopping area, schools, or residential areas)? And why are the areas you mentioned important to you?
column4: Q3: Have you done anything to improve the air quality in your home or neighborhood? If so, what did you do? If not, what prevents you from taking action?
column5: Q4: Where do you get information about air quality in your neighborhood, your home, and working place?
column6: Q5: How would you like to receive information about the air quality in your neighborhood? (e.g., from social media, text messages, newsletter from city/county to your email, neighborhood associations etc.)
column7: Q6: There will be opportunities for you to participate in deciding where to deploy the air quality monitoring sensors. How would you like to be part of it? For instance, attending the community outreach event or connect with our working group to be the messenger to deliver this information to your neighborhood or other ways?
